title: Mobile-Based Component Display Theory Application in Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and adaptability to digital environments
context.additional_context: Mobile app-based language learning content delivery in BYOD environments, emphasizing learner-driven activities

learning_goals: Learners can apply target language grammatical structures with 80% accuracy through a five-stage component-display theory framework: activity presentation → rule explanation → example provision → practice execution → feedback delivery
Learners can utilize 100 contextually relevant vocabulary items required for real-life communication scenarios through context-based language activities provided on mobile platforms
Learners achieve a minimum score of 70+ in each language skill domain (reading, writing, listening, speaking) on summative assessments
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
